intro: Seseli grubovii, commonly known as the Grubov's seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in alpine environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
